segment.source: Learn about the Windows Device Portal core REST APIs that you can use to access the data and control your device programmatically.
segment.target: Learn about the Windows Device Portal core REST APIs that you can use to access the data and control your device programmatically.

segment.source: Everything in the Windows Device Portal is built on top of REST APIs that you can use to access the data and control your device programmatically.
segment.target: Everything in the Windows Device Portal is built on top of REST APIs that you can use to access the data and control your device programmatically.

segment.source: Create a realtime ETW session over a websocket

segment.target: You can create a realtime ETW session by using the following request format.

segment.source: This will be managed over a websocket.
segment.target: This will be managed over a websocket.

segment.source: ETW events are batched on the server and sent to the client once per second.
segment.target: ETW events are batched on the server and sent to the client once per second.

segment.source: The response includes the ETW events from the enabled providers.
segment.target: The response includes the ETW events from the enabled providers.

segment.source: This API has the following expected status codes.
segment.target: This API has the following expected status codes.

segment.source: These commands are sent from the client to the server.
segment.target: These commands are sent from the client to the server.

segment.source: Enable the provider marked by {guid} (without brackets) at the specified level.
segment.target: Enable the provider marked by {guid} (without brackets) at the specified level.

segment.source: {level} is an int from 1 (least detail) to 5 (verbose).
segment.target: {level} is an int from 1 (least detail) to 5 (verbose).

segment.source: Disable the provider marked by {guid} (without brackets).
segment.target: Disable the provider marked by {guid} (without brackets).

segment.source: This responses is sent from the server to the client.
segment.target: This responses is sent from the server to the client.

segment.source: This is sent as text and you get the following format by parsing the JSON.
segment.target: This is sent as text and you get the following format by parsing the JSON.

segment.source: Payload objects are extra key-value pairs (string:string) that are provided in the original ETW event.
segment.target: Payload objects are extra key-value pairs (string:string) that are provided in the original ETW event.
